stem: The nurse is analyzing the Social Determinants of Health (SDOH) for a group of clients. For each barrier listed, select whether it primarily affects Access to Care, Health Literacy, or Economic Stability. Each barrier may affect more than one category.

rows.text: A client living in a 'food desert' with no grocery stores within 10 miles.
A client whose primary language is not the same as the clinical staff.
A client who is unable to afford the monthly co-pay for their insulin.
A client who lacks high-speed internet in a region where specialty care is only available via telehealth.

rationale.correct: SDOH categories often overlap. (r1) Food deserts are a result of economic instability (neighborhood poverty) and directly impact access to nutrition. (r2) Language barriers are a primary driver of decreased health literacy (understanding instructions). (r3) High drug costs are an economic stability issue that blocks access to life-saving treatment. (r4) The 'digital divide' is a modern barrier specifically impacting access to care in decentralized systems.
rationale.incorrect: Language barriers themselves do not necessarily imply a lack of economic stability or physical access, though they often correlate.
clinicalPearls: Social determinants of health account for nearly 80% of health outcomes, exceeding the impact of clinical care alone.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: Remember that money (Economic Stability) is the engine behind almost all other determinants. If the client can't afford something, it usually impacts Access as well.

mnemonic.title: S-D-O-H
mnemonic.expansion: Social background, Diet/Environment, Opportunity (Economic), Health education.

reviewUnits.heading: SDOH: Nursing Assessment
reviewUnits.body: The 2026 NGN requires nurses to identify non-biological factors affecting health. This includes screening for housing, transportation, and 'digital literacy' as part of the admission process.
